title: Introduction to Python and Basic Syntax

questions.question: What is Python?
Who created Python?
In which year was Python first released?
What is IDLE in the context of Python?
choices: An Integrated Development and Learning Environment
questions.answer: An Integrated Development and Learning Environment

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common use of Python in Timor-Leste, as mentioned in the module?
What does it mean that Python is dynamically typed?
choices: Variables must be declared with a type
Variable types are inferred based on the data they hold
Variables can only hold one type of data
Variable types are determined at compile time
questions.answer: Variable types are inferred based on the data they hold

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid variable name in Python?
What is the correct way to create a variable 'age' with the value 25 in Python?
Which data type would be used to store the price of coffee in USD?
What is the output of the following code: print(10 // 3)?
Which operator is used for exponentiation in Python?
What does the '%' operator do in Python?
How do you create a string variable 'name' with the value 'Maria' in Python?
What is the correct way to concatenate two strings in Python?
Which of the following is a valid boolean value in Python?
What is the purpose of the print() function in Python?
choices: To input data from the user
To output information to the console
questions.answer: To output information to the console

questions.question: What is an f-string in Python?
choices: A string that only contains floating-point numbers
A formatted string literal that allows embedding expressions
A special type of string used for file handling
questions.answer: A formatted string literal that allows embedding expressions

questions.question: How do you create an f-string in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using Python mentioned in the module?
What does it mean that Python is an interpreted language?
choices: Code is executed line by line
It can only run on specific hardware
It automatically translates code to machine language
questions.answer: Code is executed line by line

questions.question: How does Python enforce code structure?
choices: By requiring explicit declaration of variables
Using indentation to define code blocks
questions.answer: Using indentation to define code blocks

questions.question: What is the correct way to comment a single line in Python?
Which of the following is a valid comparison operator in Python?
What is the result of 5 + '5' in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a logical operator in Python?
What is the purpose of the input() function in Python?
choices: To print output to the console
To read user input from the keyboard
questions.answer: To read user input from the keyboard

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to import a module named 'math' in Python?
